org.jooby

Interface Jooby.Module

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Akka, ApiTool, Assets, Auth, Aws, Banner, CaffeineCache, Camel, Cassandra, CommonsEmail, Consulby, Couchbase, Crash, Ebeanby, Eh, Elasticsearch, EventBusby, Exec, FileWatcher, FlashScope, Flywaydb, Frontend, Ftl, GuavaCache, Gzon, Hbm, Hbs, Hbv, Hcast, Jackson, Jade, Jdbc, Jdbi, Jdbi3, Jetty, Jongoby, jOOQ, org.jooby.internal.sitemap.JSitemap, LiveReload, Metrics, Micrometer, Mongodb, MongoRx, Monphia, Neo4j, Netty, Npm, Pac4j, Pebble, Quartz, QueryDSL, Reactor, Redis, RedisSentinel, Requery, Rockerby, Rx, RxJdbc, Scanner, ServerInitializer.ServletModule, Sitemap, SpyMemcached, Thl, Undertow, Whoops, XSS, XSS, Yarn, Yasson
    Enclosing class:
    Jooby 

    public static interface Jooby.Module
    A module can publish or produces: routes, Parser, Renderer, and any other application specific service or contract of your choice.

    It is similar to Module except for the callback method receives a Env, Config and Binder.

    A module can provide his own set of properties through the config() method. By default, this method returns an empty config object.

    For example: 
       use(new M1());
   use(new M2());
   use(new M3());
    Previous example had the following order (first-listed are higher priority):
    • System properties
    • application.conf
    • M3 properties
    • M2 properties
    • M1 properties

    A module can provide start/stop methods in order to start or close resources.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar
    See Also:
    Jooby.use(Jooby.Module)

      All Methods  Instance Methods  Abstract Methods  Default Methods

      default com.typesafe.config.Config config() 
      void configure(Env env, com.typesafe.config.Config conf, com.google.inject.Binder binder)
      Configure and produces bindings for the underlying application.

    • Method Detail

      • config

        @Nonnull
default com.typesafe.config.Config config()
        Returns:
        Produces a module config object (when need it). By default a module doesn't produce any configuration object.

      • configure

        void configure(Env env,
               com.typesafe.config.Config conf,
               com.google.inject.Binder binder)
        throws Throwable
        Configure and produces bindings for the underlying application. A module can optimize or customize a service by checking current the application env and/or the current application properties available from Config.
        Parameters:
        env - The current application's env. Not null.
        conf - The current config object. Not null.
        binder - A guice binder. Not null.
        Throws:
        Throwable - If something goes wrong.
